meanings.definition: A type of fabric woven with reinforced threads to prevent tearing.
meanings.sent1: The backpack was made of ripstops, so it didn't tear easily.
meanings.sent2: Outdoor jackets often use ripstops to make them more durable.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was made of ripstops, ensuring it never ripped during battles.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like ripstops, unyielding to any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The tent was constructed with ripstops, guaranteeing it could withstand harsh weather conditions.

meanings.definition: To mend or reinforce a tear in fabric using a ripstop technique.
meanings.sent1: She carefully ripstops the hole in her jeans to prevent it from getting bigger.
meanings.sent2: The tailor ripstops the torn shirt to make it as good as new.
meanings.sent3: He ripstops the ripped seam with precision, making it look seamless.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship ripstops any disagreements, keeping them close.
meanings.sent5: The quick repair ripstops the damage, saving the day.
